author: gpkumar24
title: Receipt Wallet
description: Recibos, contas, faturas difíceis de acompanhar e também estas têm muitas histórias e informações não contadas.

f6_assessments.q0: An app to track invoices and receipts is a great idea, however the proposal does not show clearly how the project is close to completion (in fact the funds are intended to hire a developer) and how there will be a usable product in 90 days. In my opinion, the proposal does not address the challenge because the proposal does not clearly show a path to an end product useable by end users with in 90days. The proposal fails to demonstrate how users and utility will be attracted to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: I would like to see the team provide links to previous experience and/or a github repository.  I would like to see more information on the current state of the project development and additional information on the team and background. I would like to see the team expand on the plan to have the project ready for market in 90 days. I would like the team to expand on the how backend architecture will tie in with the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q2: I would like to see the team develop a simple 3month roadmap with milestones to connect the funds expenditure with the goals of the proposal. I would like the team to develop KPI's to help track performance,for example have POS integrated by wek 4, have 10 businesses signed up by week 8, have 200 users for close circle by week 10 etc. I feel the information provided is might be challenging to audit the progress and success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications:  in my year long work in political organisations I have been both a treasurer of a political organisation and a financial auditor (someone that checks the books of an organisation to verify that all the funds proceedings are in order). Hence, can bring in some competencies in evaluating the budgets in this category on their credibility and accountability. In programming specific costs in budgets I draw my knowledge from research and university education in programming but not personal professional experience in the field of IT, hence this part of my assesments in this categeory will be more superficial and more focused on the general budget rationale with the research done in mind. The proposal identifies a general everyday problem that however does not really have aanything to do with the challenge, and while they refer to PoS blockchains several times they do not really bring across what the connection to their proposal is. The proposal does not really articulate how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. As far as I understand it will mainly add value to businesses wanting to fish for consumer data.
The key metrics and goals of the proposal only partialy adress the outlined challenge settings.
The proposal does not really adress scalability, but might be able to  scale to address future challenges. If done right
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer does not provide sufficient information about themselves and does not provide proof for any relevant qualifications. Feedback: For future proposals, maybe consider linking some verifiable personal information about yourself or some of the work you have already done. The proposer does not seem to know the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal, as they want to hire one Dev for a task that would take a long time (e.G. designing an AI data analysis tool for obtaining marketing information out of receipts + the several other points they mentioned. Feedback: Try to define you goals more clearly and breaking them down in differentiated points for each of which you define the requirements. The budget is not outlined clearly nor broken down into identifiable items. The proposer only mentions a lump sum and some points for which it is used. Feedback: A budget broken down by items should be used next time. For such complex projects with so many points that need to be adressed I'd also advise you to present a plan for the case that you need additional funding, which would most definetely be the case if you want to fulfill this proposal completely.
In this case, the budget does not seem reasonable because far too much things are proposed to fit in this budget. The proposal does not offer a timetable to complete the work.
The overall implementation plan lacks sophistication and technical detail, which gives the impression the proposer has not thought about the details of technical implementation, which should be a prerequisite for posting a proposal. The plan does not describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal other than some people they want to hire.
 The proposer has not done a general assessment of challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
No roadmap with milestones or a time horizon exists, which will make it difficult to audit the proposal.  Metrics and KPIs that define the success of the proposal are not presented in a concrete, quantitative manner, but only some not very defined, partially inconcrete points of what should be achieved.
 While the d escription of the targeted problem is sufficiently comprehensible,
The description of the solution that addresses the problem is a bit confusing as it throws together the actual solution (an app that stores receipts) together with SPOs, Data collection and AI without going furthrt into them. Feedback: Keep it simple. This is after all a mini proposal challenge. Go for one concrete goal, but define this one very well and consider everything as detailed as possible instead of proposing an overcomplex solution that throws different things together while not explaining and defining everything properly.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is well placed within the challenge and has a strong idea however It is unclear how the proposal will bring value to the Cardano ecosystem as aa whole at this stage as it does not mention integration until later rollouts. A clear plan on how this will be integrated into blockchain would be great to see in future rounds.
f6_assessments.q1: They mention hiring a developer to perform the tasks once funded but there is no mention of the current teams skills or abilities and an insufficient breakdown of allocated funds to make this project feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no clear roadmap. Additionally no KPIs have been listed and therefore makes auditing the success of this project impossible.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the problem of many users in every country. The simple operation of scanning documents will save time and encourage more users. The use of POS also will make the implementation faster and the extension of the project is quite interesting with obvious benefits to users and partners
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal is simple at first and gradually expands the benefits of users and partners. The proposer' experience is well valued however I have too little information about the development team as well as technical issues will need more information.
f6_assessments.q2: The details of the benefits from the proposed idea are interesting, but I need more clarity the results to be achieved as well as the details of the Dapp. With the function of scanning and storing information, I can't figure out how to use all the other features of the application. I'd suggest to add specific features of the application to get clear result of the app.

solution: Um aplicativo simples com scanner QR e captura de fotos para escanear e armazenar por telefone, que oferece fácil acesso quando necessário
